author: Mark Perez-Krywany
title: Keystone graduate Gideon ‘ESPN’ Lampron is living up to the middle name at UD Football – Morning Journal
text:
Gideon “ESPN” Lampron has always wanted to put on a show on the gridiron.
Lampron did it at Keystone. Two years later, he found his fit at Dayton, where he stars at linebacker.
“This is something that I have been wanting for so long,” he said. “I’ve always wanted the responsibility of starting, especially at the college level. This is something that I have been dreaming of since I was in eighth grade. It’s been surreal, but I have been expecting it.”
Dayton defeated St. Francis, 18-10, in its season opener. He was such a force in his first start, Lampron was awarded the FCS National Defensive Player of the Week.
View this post on Instagram
A post shared by Dayton Flyers Football (@daytonflyersfb)
He had six solo tackles (11 total), a pair of forced fumbles, a fumble recovery, one sack and three tackles for loss.
“I feel like he’s been handling the expectations well,” Dayton Coach Trevor Andrews said. “He was the national defensive player of the week, so I’d say I feel exceptional about it right now. No pressure, but all he has got to do is repeat the same performance every week and I’ll be very happy with him.”
When looking at Lampron’s social media pages, the name ESPN could appear as a nickname for the former Wildcat. However, it is actually his middle name, given by his father Marty, an avid sports fan.
“I want to make my dad proud, because him making my middle name ‘ESPN,’ it has set some expectations. I am just trying to deliver,” he said. “(Marty Lampron) loves watching me play sports more than anything in his life.”
Gideon’s original middle name was set to be Xavior. Marty Lampron vetoed it and had it set to ESPN, all caps and pronounced by the letters for the Entertainment Sports Programming Network.
“I wouldn’t have it any other way,” Lampron said. “Some of my friends would laugh. I never really hid it, I just never talked about it ever. Now, this is something that my friends are finding out. I have it on my Instagram and (X). I love (my middle name).”
Lampron was the Keystone leader at linebacker and running back. So much so, he was named as one of nine finalists for Ohio Mr. Football in 2021.
That is one of many accolades he acquired in LaGrange, as he was also awarded the Matt Wilhelm Award his junior year and Lorain County Golden Helmet award in his senior season.
Keystone running back Gideon Lampron takes advantage of the opening the offense created for him and moves the ball upfield. (Jennifer Forbus – for The Morning Journal) He had a fresh start at Dayton, as his teammates were just as talented. He stuck to it and kept working his way through his first two seasons, and he contributed on special teams.
During his time, Dayton went through a coaching change to Andrews, a UD alum, in 2023, which was after Lampron’s freshman year.
“Right after I got the job here in January of 2023 is when I first found out. I thought the guys were messing with me,” Andrews said. “But Jake Speller, our operations director was with the previous staff, told me (ESPN) really was his middle name. I thought his dad was either really awesome or out of his mind.”
There were also changes to the linebacker coaches. Once it was set to Coach Paul Amakihe, Lampron’s career began to take off.
“I gotta give a lot of the success that I have had to Coach A (Amakihe),” he said. “It’s been him. I have learned so much from him. Spending so much time with him, we have such a great relationship. He coaches me hard, but I wouldn’t want it any other way.”
In the linebacking group, two leaders are assigned to become the spark plugs, brains and the brawn of the defense.
“As a teammate, Gideon (Lampron) is very well-liked,” Andrews said. “He plays with great effort and energy. He has very quick reaction skills so he makes a lot of impact plays. That potential has always been there, but he wasn’t always going in the right direction. Now that he has more experience, confidence under his belt and a year in our scheme, he has become more confident and that’s translating to the production that you’re seeing now.”
Dayton is 1-0. The Flyers have a bye-week in Week 2, and their next game will be against Indiana State, which played Purdue in Week 1. The Boilermarkers have Lampron’s former Keystone teammate Ryne Shackelford on their roster.
“One thing (I’ve noticed), especially after watching the game on film is that I could have played so much better,” he said. “Now I just have to keep the same energy. I can’t keep reading my own headlines. We still have a lot more football to be played. I am not satisfied.”
Dayton’s next game is scheduled for Sept. 14, which will be broadcast on ESPN+.

author: ansa.it
title: Nubifragio a Roma, traffico in tilt e caos in città - Notizie - Ansa.it
text:
Traffico in tilt, disagi e caos. Un violento nubifragio si sta abbattendo in questi minuti su Roma mandando in paralisi molte delle principali arterie stradali, già in difficoltà a causa dello sciopero dei mezzi pubblici.
 Diverse strade sono allagate, in particolare nell’area sud della Capitale. Segnalati anche incidenti stradali e auto ferme.
 Particolarmente caotica la situazione nel centro storico, tra Colosseo, Circo Massimo e lungotevere, ma anche nell’area nord-ovest della città.
Odissea per passeggeri in arrivo da Dubai
Odissea per i passeggeri a bordo di un Boeing 777 della Emirates il cui arrivo a Roma era previsto per le 18:45. A causa del forte maltempo che imperversa sulla Capitale, il volo è stato deviato su Ciampino con un atterraggio, riferiscono alcuni passeggeri all’ANSA, “da incubo”. Il volo si trova ancora a Ciampino in attesa del rifornimento di carburante necessario per ritornare sullo scalo di Fiumicino e atterrare, infine, al Leonardo da Vinci come previsto. “Siamo bloccati sulla pista – riferiscono alcuni passeggeri -, in attesa di poter ripartire. C’è forte disagio, soprattutto pe rl’atterraggio che è stato da brividi, c’è chi è stato male di stomaco”.
Riproduzione riservata © Copyright ANSA

author: Maurizio De Santis
title: Salta il Decreto Crescita, scenario apocalittico: “Juve, Milan e Roma rischiano di essere distrutte”
text:
Salta il Decreto Crescita, scenario apocalittico: “Juve, Milan e Roma rischiano di essere distrutte”
Lo scenario tracciato dal senatore di Forza Italia e presidente della Lazio, Claudio Lotito (nella foto), è apocalittico. La
mancata proroga del Decreto Crescita assesta un colpo tremendo al calcio italiano. Definisce lo stralcio della misura dal provvedimento Milleproroghe avvenuto in Consiglio dei Ministri una "bella e grande fesseria". Prefigura una perdita di competitività progressiva della Serie A: "L'anno scorso abbiamo portato tre squadre in tutte e tre le finali, adesso voglio vedere che fine facciamo…". E attacca l'Aic (Associazione Italia Calciatori) che s'era detta contraria al rinnovo della delibera per altri due mesi (fino a febbraio 2024) scrivendo una lettera al Governo.
La discussione in CdM è stata accesa e il comunicato della Lega
sugli "sconti fiscali immorali" previsti per i calciatori è stato un diretto duro da incassare per lo stesso massimo dirigente: lo aveva caldeggiato e ora, a meno che in Parlamento non si prenda direzione differente, sul tavolo resta un tema spinoso per tutte le società per la morsa nella quale finiranno a partire dal prossimo mese di gennaio (niente più agevolazioni per il tesseramento di sportivi provenienti dall'estero).
"Si accorgeranno di che cavolo di errore è stato fatto – ha ammesso Lotito, come riportato dal sito notizie.com -. Se tu hai uno straniero che paga le tasse in Italia sarà meglio di uno che non viene e non le paga no? Voglio vedere chi viene adesso…".
L’abolizione non avrà effetti retroattivi: i club che hanno contratti in essere non perderanno i benefici fiscali e ne godranno per un massimo di cinque anni; quanto alla questione rinnovi, quelli sanciti entro il 31 dicembre (
è il caso di Osimhen col Napoli, ufficializzato nei giorni scorsi – foto in basso) non vedranno scemate le agevolazioni. Ma dal 1° gennaio 2024 in poi cambierà tutto e gli sgravi non saranno più applicabili.
"La Lazio ha i suoi contratti, ma non è tanto quello il tema – ha aggiunto Lotito a corredo dello sfogo -. Il vero problema è che alcune società… grandi club com la Juventus, il Milan (
tra le società che ha risparmiato di più finora, ndr) e la Roma potrebbero anche essere distrutte da questo tipo di situazione. Adesso chi era contrario a questa cosa ci farà vedere cosa sarà in grado di fare".
Il riferimento per niente affatto velato è all'Aic: "Era contraria. Ma ha detto delle cose talmente infondate e che sono fuori da ogni logica. Quale? Questo decreto rappresenterebbe un problema per la crescita dei vivai italiani. Ma che porti quelli di 14 anni in prima squadra?".
Serie A
[segui](#)

author: Jessica Barshis
title: REVEALED: London acid attacker is Afghan immigrant given asylum in UK after 3 attempts
text: [GB news](https://www.gbnews.com/news/london-chemical-attacker-asylum-seeker-new-cctv-image-released)that Abdul Shokoor Ezedi, the man responsible for the alleged acid attack in London which sent a mother and her toddler to the hospital, is an [Afghan immigrant](https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/1862227/london-acid-attacker-spotted-kings-cross)who failed to gain asylum in the UK his first 2 attempts. Ezedi was convicted of a sexual assault in 2018 at Newcastle Crown Court and sources say he was given a suspended sentence for "sexual assault/exposure." He was discharged from probation in 2020. Ezedi has not been apprehended and is considered a fugitive. Supt Gabriel Cameron from the police [told reporters](https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/abdul-ezedi-fugitive-convicted-sex-32023662): "We are now naming the man we want to speak to as Abdul Shokoor Ezedi, who is aged 35. We believe he travelled down from Newcastle earlier that day. We don’t know yet what led to it. We’re working to establish the circumstances. “A manhunt to trace Ezedi is under way. We are working with partner agencies and forces including the British Transport Police to locate and arrest him. If you see Ezedi, call 999 immediately. He should NOT be approached. He has significant injuries to the right side of the face. We will catch him. I am wholeheartedly confident... We will catch the male." One of his neighbors, Mohammad Hussain Nazary, also told reporters: "I’d see him around the area and he’d come in from time to time. He’s an Afghan and I assumed he was single because I never saw him with a partner or family, he was always on his own. He seemed like an ordinary harmless guy, certainly not someone you’d associate with something like this. He was around quite a lot but I haven’t seen him in maybe six or seven months." The victims of the attack, a 3-year-old child and her mother, remain in the hospital with "life-changing injuries." According to [witnesses](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-13033379/Police-say-Clapham-chemical-attacker-Newcastle-area-continue-hunt-run-suspect-mother-two-young-children-doused-corrosive-substance.html), Ezedi appeared to slam the child to the ground repeatedly in the attack. The mother is believed to be known to Ezedi. This is a developing story. Refresh the page for updates.

author: PTI
title: Over 200 Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport Due To Bad Weather
text:
More than 200 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport on Friday morning due to bad weather conditions, an official said.
PTI
03 Jan 2025, 01:21 PM IST 03 Jan 2025, 01:21 PM IST 03 Jan 2025, 01:21 PM IST WhatsApp X (was Twitter) Facebook Telegram Save
About 150 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport on Friday morning due to bad weather conditions (Source: Delhi Airport/X) Over 200 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport on Friday morning due to bad weather conditions, according to NDTV. The national capital witnessed dense fog resulting in low visibility. The official said over 100 flights have been delayed but there are no diversions so far.
"While landing and takeoffs continue at Delhi Airport, flights that are not CAT III compliant may get affected. Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information. Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," Delhi International Airport Ltd., said in a post on X at 6.35 am.
The CAT III facility allows aircraft to operate in low visibility conditions. The Indira Gandhi International Airport, operated by DIAL, handles around 1,300 flight movements daily.
ALSO READ Air India Rolls Out 'Complimentary' WiFi Internet For Domestic Flights Opinion Air India Rolls Out 'Complimentary' WiFi Internet For Domestic Flights Read More

author: Amaris Encinas
title: What does 12/31/23 mean? The last day of 2023 is an angel number
text: NYE 2023 is on a unique date that occurs once every 100 years: Here's what 12/31/23 means. [Amaris Encinas](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/5133245001/amaris-encinas/) The upcoming year will be filled with blessings, at least that is what the numerical sequence of this New Year’s Eve date suggests. If you take a closer look at the date, written as 12/31/23 or even 123123, you might see an angel number, which are [repeating number sequence](/story/life/2022/11/06/what-are-angel-numbers-meanings-numerology/10525252002/)s, often used as a guide for deeper spiritual exploration. The numerical sequences can range anywhere from [000](/story/life/2022/11/30/angel-number-000-meaning/10589434002/) to [999](/story/life/2023/01/30/angel-number-999-meaning/10806425002/), with each number having a distinct meaning and energy, USA Today previously [reported. ](/story/life/2022/11/06/what-are-angel-numbers-meanings-numerology/10525252002/) The once-in-a-century date, which won’t be seen again on our calenders until Dec. 31, 2123, marks a new beginning. One, that asks us to “transform and evolve with the times and in the right place to embrace what is coming to us,” [according to the Old Farmer’s Almanac website. ](https://www.almanac.com/123123-meaning-123123) The date has also sparked an online trend, with TikTok users creating videos on the significance of the number and merchandise commemorating the date selling online, including on platforms like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/s?k=123123&ref=cs_503_search), [eBay](https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_from=R40&_trksid=p2332490.m570.l1313&_nkw=123123&_sacat=0) and [Etsy](https://www.etsy.com/market/123123?ref=seller_tag_bottom_image-1), the Detroit Free Press, part of the USA Today Network [reported.](/story/news/local/michigan/2023/12/27/angel-number-meaning-123123-last-day-year-numerology/72001298007/) Here’s what we know about the date. What does 12/31/23 signify within numerology? [Numerology is an ancient esoteric science](https://www.britannica.com/topic/numerology) that deals with numbers and letters and the energy, intention and vibration behind them, professional numerologist [Novalee Wilder](https://www.novaleewilder.com/) shared with USA Today earlier this month. "Before there was even language, there were numbers," she said. "Before we had named things, we had counted them, and we had assigned meaning to that count." The numbers that make up the angel number are just as important as the whole number, especially when you are trying to determine the vibration and intention behind the number. Professional astrologer [Narayana Montúfar](https://www.naramon.com/) told [ Farmer’s Almanac ](https://www.almanac.com/123123-meaning-123123) that the “Number 1 brings the very spark of initiation, 2 focuses on building, and 3 is related to the concept of creation. Together, the sequence of these three numbers speaks of the spark of initiation that seeks to build a new creation.” If you add all the numbers that make up the date 123123 together, you will come up with 12. The number 12 in numerology can symbolize spiritual enlightenment, with potential for the day to deliver epiphanies and “aha” moments for individuals and society at large, the website stated. FYI: [How to keep your pets calm during New Year's Eve fireworks](/story/graphics/2023/12/28/keep-dog-calm-new-years-eve-fireworks/71999504007/) What are some dates to keep in mind in 2024? If you are an angel number enthusiast, there are a few key dates you might want to keep in mind as 2024 rapidly approaches. A palindrome, not unlike an angel number, is a term typically reserved for words or phrases that are spelled the same way backward as they are forward. Words like level, kayak, civic, and radar are among some of the most common palindromes, according to the [Old Farmer’s Almanac. ](https://www.farmersalmanac.com/its-palindrome-day-14486) Numerical sequences seen in dates or times can also be palindromes, the most well-recognized ones being 3/20/23 or [11:11](https://www.farmersalmanac.com/1111-good-luck-and-history), the website stated. Here are all palindrome dates that will occur in 2024, courtesy of the [Farmer’s Almanac](https://www.farmersalmanac.com/its-palindrome-day-14486): - 4/2/24 - 4/20/24 - 4/21/24 - 4/22/24 - 4/23/24 - 4/24/24 - 4/25/24 - 4/26/24 - 4/27/24 - 4/28/24 - 4/29/24 Contributing: Olivia Munson, USA Today 30 famous Capricorns you should know: [These celebrities belong to the winter Zodiac sign](/story/entertainment/celebrities/2023/11/29/famous-people-that-are-capricorns/71489302007/)

author: DARYL SIMIONE FOR LNP | LANCASTERONLINE
title: 8 Lancaster County players earn All-State honors in high school girls volleyball | Girls' volleyball | lancasteronline.com
text: Eight players from Lancaster County schools have earned All-State honors from the Pennsylvania Volleyball Coaches Association for 2024. The four players honored from the Lancaster-Lebanon League were Hempfield’s Addison Leber and Bryce Calabretta, and Manheim Township’s Gracie Reinhart on the Class 4A team, and Lancaster Catholic’s Molly Wentz on the Class 2A team. From the CCAC, Linville Hill’s Desiree Smucker, Lyndi Esh and Kaley Higgins joined Ephrata Mennonite’s Joelle Burkholder on the Class 1A team. Leber, a senior outside hitter, earned her third All-State selection for L-L champion Hempfield, which won a sixth consecutive District Three title before reaching the PIAA semifinals for the second year in a row. Calabretta, an outside hitter, was one of just two freshmen to be named All-State. Reinhart, a senior opposite, helped the Blue Streaks reach the L-L final, the District Three semifinals and the PIAA Tournament for the first time since 2000. Wentz, a senior outside hitter, helped the Crusaders reach the District Three playoffs for the third straight season. Smucker, a senior outside hitter, and Esh, a senior libero, helped Linville Hill win its first District Three playoff match and first District Three title before surging all the way to the PIAA final. Higgins, a junior outside hitter, was the primary offensive threat for the Warriors. Burkholder, a junior middle hitter, helped Ephrata Mennonite reach the District Three final — where it lost to Linville Hill — as well as the PIAA Tournament for the first time in program history.
